questions.question_text:
You have a yearly calendar for 2022. When you click to expand the calendar into a single monthly view, you always need to click on the 15th of each month and add an event. The following reflects the selector for the Event Date Element activity in March:
<wnd app='applicationframehost.exe' title='Month View - Calendar' />
<uia cls='Day' name='15 March 2022' />
How should the selector be modified to ensure it clicks on the 15th of the current month?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
answer is C

Selected Answer: C
The given answer is correct

questions.question_text: Which Data Table activity has a property setting that adds columns to an input datatable?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
merge datatable is the answer as it is the only one that can add columns through missing schema to an input property table.

Selected Answer: C
This question is not very clear on the details. "...adds columns to an input data table." Non of these options can add columns to an input data table. "Merge Data Table" can add missing columns to a destination data table using the "add" option in the "missingSchemaAction" property. And to me this might be technically correct but it is not an input data table, it will be an output again. But also "Build Data Table" gives you the functionality to add columns but this is manually before the workflow runs. And again this is not on an "input data table", as stated in the question, but rather an output data table. If I had to choose, I would choose C.

Selected Answer: A
With Build datatable activity you can add columns go test in studio

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A developer plans to build an automation process using the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework with Orchestrator queues. Based on UiPath best practice, what is the recommended sequence of steps to update the template and create/update Queues and Values?
Instructions: Drag the Description found on the "Left" and drop on the correct Step Sequence found on the "Right".
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct answer according to ChatGPT is:
1.Edit the configuration file, DataConfig.xlsx
2. Create the queue in Orchestrator and set the Retry value as per the process documentation
3. Set a proper value for out_TransactionID argument in the Assign out_TransactionID activity
4. Edit the Process.xaml workflow with logic using data from each Transaction Item
(passed my Microsoft Exams with ChatGPT)

questions.question_text: A developer defined two Int32 variables, FirstInt and SecondInt, in a workflow. Which panel can the developer use to monitor the result of the expression. FirstInt > SecondInt, throughout the execution of the workflow in Debug mode?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Watch panel is the right ans

Selected Answer: D
In Immediate Panel, you can write or evaluate a expression.
https://docs.uipath.com/studio/standalone/2023.4/user-guide/the-immediate-panel

Selected Answer: C
Tested in Studion. Can be also Immediate Panel if you write the expresion FirstInit > SecondInit

questions.question_text:
A developer created an automation project in the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework which needs to enter a User ID depending on the machine it runs on. The User ID is stored in Orchestrator as a Text asset using the Value Per Account-Machine method.
Which steps should the developer perform to use this asset in the project?

choices.B:
Add a row in the Settings sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
In the workflow, retrieve the User ID by referencing the Config dictionary.
choices.C:
Add a row in the Assets sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
Use the Get Asset activity in the workflow to get the User ID.
choices.D:
Add a row in the Assets sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
In the workflow, retrieve the User ID by referencing the Config dictionary.
choices.A:
Add a row in the Settings sheet in Config.xlsx with the name of the Orchestrator asset.
Use the Get Asset activity in the workflow to get the User ID.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In the REFramework everything from the config file is saved in a dictionary. There is not need to use the "Get Asset" activity in the workflow. That can be used without entering the Orchestrator Asset into the config file. Best practice is to enter and use information from the config file.

Selected Answer: D
If you use a REFramework i think the correct answer must be D, you dont need to use Get Assets activity.
